metadata.title: CVE-2023-24537 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Calling any of the Parse functions on Go source code which contains //linedirectives with very large line numbers can cause an infinite loop due tointeger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

golang-1.16 - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
golang-1.16-go - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
golang-1.16-src - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1').
golang-1.16 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1').
golang-1.18 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4').
